ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Agentic CLI development
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ LLM provider flexibility â€¢ MCP support â€¢ Undo functionality â€¢ Model switching â€¢ JIT-style system prompt injection
ðŸ“– Summary: Sidekick is an agentic CLI developer tool that allows users to enhance their command-line workflows with AI. It offers features like LLM provider flexibility, MCP support, and per-project customization, aiming to provide an open-source alternative to similar tools while maintaining an agentic workflow.

âœ¨ weblookrs | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Capturing screenshots and recordings of web pages for local development and testing.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Screenshot capture of web pages â€¢ Animated GIF recording of web pages â€¢ Configurable wait time and recording length â€¢ Configurable viewport size â€¢ JavaScript execution before capture
ðŸ“– Summary: WebLook is a command-line tool designed for capturing screenshots and recordings of web pages. It offers features such as configurable wait times, viewport sizes, JavaScript execution, and browser console log capture. The tool is intended to support local development workflows by providing a simple way to capture visual states of web applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ shellfirm | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Preventing accidental or harmful shell commands from being executed.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intercepts risky shell commands â€¢ Prompts users with challenges for verification â€¢ Customizable patterns for command interception â€¢ Supports Zsh and Bash
ðŸ“– Summary: Shellfirm intercepts potentially dangerous shell commands and prompts users with a verification challenge, acting as a 'captcha for your terminal'. It helps prevent accidental data loss or system damage by requiring users to confirm risky actions. The tool supports customizable patterns and integrates with Zsh and Bash.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ KrbRelayEx | C#
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Performing Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attacks by relaying Kerberos AP-REQ tickets to access SMB shares or HTTP ADCS endpoints.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Relay Kerberos AP-REQ tickets â€¢ Interactive multithreaded SMB consoles â€¢ Multithreaded port forwarding â€¢ Transparent relaying process â€¢ Cross-platform compatibility
ðŸ“– Summary: KrbRelayEx is a C# tool designed for Kerberos relay attacks, enabling Man-in-the-Middle exploitation by manipulating DNS entries. It relays Kerberos AP-REQ tickets to access SMB shares or HTTP ADCS endpoints, offering features like multithreaded SMB consoles and port forwarding. The tool is cross-platform compatible and intended for legitimate security testing and research.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ Free-Proxy | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a list of free proxies for use in Termux and Linux environments.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Free proxy list â€¢ Proxy checker â€¢ Termux installation support â€¢ Linux installation support â€¢ Update functionality
ðŸ“– Summary: The Free-Proxy repository provides a collection of free proxy servers. It includes installation instructions for both Termux and Linux, a proxy checker, and update functionality. The repository aims to offer readily available proxies for users on these platforms.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ ballcat | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Rapidly building enterprise-level backend management systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Rapid development scaffolding â€¢ Enterprise-level backend management system â€¢ Pre-built starters for feature extension â€¢ Front and back-end user separation
ðŸ“– Summary: Ballcat is a rapid development scaffolding that enables developers to quickly build enterprise-level backend management systems. It provides pre-built starters for extending functionality and includes features such as user separation, menu/data permissions, logging, exception handling, and security measures like XSS and SQL injection prevention. The project aims to simplify and accelerate the development process for enterprise applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ Peergos | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Secure, private, peer-to-peer file storage, social networking, and application hosting with user-controlled data and privacy.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Peer-to-peer encrypted global filesystem â€¢ Fine-grained access control â€¢ Secure messenger â€¢ Encrypted email client and bridge â€¢ Private and secure social network
ðŸ“– Summary: Peergos is a decentralized platform focused on providing users with complete control over their data and online interactions. It achieves this through a peer-to-peer encrypted filesystem with fine-grained access control, a secure messenger, encrypted email, and a private social network. The platform aims to create a private web where users own their data and decide who can access it.
